Text: Andrew Suknaski:  He was an editor for Anak Press and Deodar Shadow Press, and founded the underground magazine "Elfin Plot" in Vancouver in 1969.

Triplets:
<Andrew Suknaski

5:
--------------------
<Text: Andrew Suknaski:  His first collection was "Wood Mountain Poems" (1976), edited by Purdy, followed by "The Ghosts Call You Poor" (1978) and "In The Name of Narid" (1981).>
Triplets:<Andrew Suknaski
7:
--------------------
Text: Andrew Suknaski:  Suknaski also worked as a researcher for the National Film Board of Canada, contributing to such films as "Grain Elevator" (1981), by Charles Konowal, and "The Disinherited" (1985), by Harvey Spak.
Triplets:<Andrew Suknaski
8:
--------------------
Text: Andrew Suknaski:  In 1978, Spak made a documentary about Suknaski, "Wood Mountain Poems".
Triplets:<Andrew Suknaski

ere is the extracted triplet:

<Andrew Suknaski
10:
--------------------
<Text: Andrew Suknaski:  He stopped writing in the 1980s and died in Moose Jaw on May 3, 2012.>
